Detailed Description

Semaphore object is a synchronization object that maintains a count between zero and a specified maximum value. The count is decremented each time a thread completes a wait for the semaphore object and incremented each time a thread releases the semaphore. When the count reaches zero, no more threads can successfully wait for the semaphore object state to become signaled. The state of a semaphore is set to signaled when its count is greater than zero, and nonsignaled when its count is zero.

Semaphore is useful in controlling a shared resource that can support a limited number of users. It acts as a gate that limits the number of threads sharing the resource to a specified maximum number.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN Semaphore::Create (  INT  init_val = 0,
INT  max_val = -1
) 
 

Parameters:
init_val Specifies an initial count for the semaphore object. This value must be greater than or equal to zero and less than or equal to max_val. The state of a semaphore is signaled when its count is greater than zero and nonsignaled when it is zero. The count is decreased by one whenever a wait function releases a thread that was waiting for the semaphore. The count is increased by a specified amount by calling the Release method.
max_val Specifies the maximum count for the semaphore object. This value must be greater than zero.
Returns:
TRUE if succeeded. FALSE if failed.

BOOLEAN Semaphore::Create (  INT  init_val = 0,
INT  max_val = -1
) 
 

BOOLEAN Semaphore::Obtain (  const Ticks &  timeout = Ticks::Infinite()  ) 
 

Obtain returns when one of the following occurs:

  • The specified object is in the signaled state.
  • The time-out interval elapses.
    Parameters:
    timeout Specifies the time-out interval, in milliseconds. The function returns if the interval elapses, even if the object's state is nonsignaled. If timeout is zero, the method tests the object's state and returns immediately. If timeout is INFINITE, the method's time-out interval never elapses.
    Returns:
    TRUE if the state is signaled. FALSE if the time-out interval elapsed.

BOOLEAN Semaphore::Obtain (  Ticks  timeout = Ticks::Infinite()  ) 
 

void Semaphore::Release (   ) 
 

Release increases the count of the semaphore object. If count exceeds max_val that was specified when the semaphore was created, the count is not changed.

void Semaphore::Release (   )
